intro: Alibertia latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf alibertia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases small, winged seeds when mature.
